H0.text: Recycling reduces littering, thereby helping the environment in the context where many cities encourage people to recycle by placing recyclable items in special containers that are picked up each week from people’s homes.

H1.text: Recycling makes products last longer, helping the environment as many cities encourage it by placing recyclable items in special containers that are picked up each week from people’s homes.

H2.text: Recycling puts less trash in the city landfill by collecting items in special containers that are picked up each week from people’s homes in many cities that encourage recycling.

H3.text: Recycling increases the amount of dust in the air, which is how recycling most likely helps the environment when many cities encourage people to recycle by placing items in a special container that is picked up each week from homes.

A4.text: It can also prevent the waste of potentially useful materials and reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reducing energy use, air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling).

A5.text: Municipalities often see fiscal benefits from implementing recycling programs, largely due to the reduced landfill costs.
